Schedule SB, Part V – Statement of Actuarial Assumptions/Methods
Funding assumptions and methods selection and rationale
Actuarial Standard of Practice No. 27 (“ASOP 27”) provides guidance to actuaries on economic assumptions for
measuring pension obligations. Actuarial Standard of Practice No. 35 (“ASOP 35”) provides guidance to actuaries
on demographic and other noneconomic assumptions for measuring pension obligations. Under these ASOPs, for
each assumption that has a significant effect on the measurement and that the actuary has selected, the actuary
should disclose the information and analysis used to support the actuary’s determination that the assumption is
reasonable. No information or analysis is needed for any assumption prescribed by law or regulation.
The interest rates and mortality assumption used for this measurement are prescribed by law.
The economic assumption that has a significant effect on the measurement and that the actuary has selected is
the expected rate of return on assets. An analysis using the Gallagher General Economy and Market Simulator
(GEMS) Model is used to set the expected rate of return on plan assets.
Demographic and other non-economic assumptions that have a significant effect on the measurement are
annuitant mortality, annuitant mortality improvement, retirement rates, withdrawal rates and frequency of optional
payment forms. The assumptions for non-annuitant mortality and non-annuitant future mortality improvement are
prescribed by law. The assumptions for annuitant mortality, annuitant mortality improvement, retirement rates,
withdrawal rates and frequency of optional payment forms were selected by the enrolled actuary and are
reasonable given historic gain and loss experience of the plan. The actuary has determined that these
assumptions do not significantly conflict with what, in the actuary’s professional judgment, are reasonable for the
purpose of the measurement. The rates are monitored annually with updates made as deemed necessary.
For assumptions that apply to the former Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan participants, the current
assumptions were set by the prior actuary. We believe the current assumptions to be reasonable.
Use of Models
Actuarial Standard of Practice No. 56 (“ASOP 56”) provides guidance to actuaries when performing actuarial
services that involve designing, developing, selecting, modifying, using, reviewing, or evaluating models.
Gallagher used third-party software to perform the calculations that underlie the actuarial information contained in
this report. The model in the third-party software calculated the actuarial information provided in this report using
plan provisions, data, and assumptions as of a measurement date under rules applicable to the calculations.
Gallagher has an extensive review process whereby the results of the calculations are checked using detailed
sample output, changes from year to year are summarized by source, and significant deviations from
expectations are investigated. Other outputs are similarly reviewed in detail and at a high level for accuracy,
reasonability, and consistency with prior results. Gallagher also reviews the model when software changes occur.
The review is performed by experts who are familiar with applicable rules and the way the model generates its
output.
Future actuarial measurements
Future actuarial measurements may differ significantly from current measurements due to plan experience
differing from that anticipated by the actuarial assumptions, changes expected as part of the natural operation of
the methodology used for these measurements, and changes in plan provisions, applicable law or regulations. An
analysis of the potential range of such future differences is beyond the scope of this report.

Prescribed Funding Assumptions and Methods
The following assumptions and methods are prescribed by ERISA.
Interest rates
For 2024 Plan Year: Full Yield Curve as of January 1, 2024
Effective Interest Rate: 5.13%
For 2023 Plan Year: Full Yield Curve as of January 1, 2023
Effective Interest Rate: 5.06%
Eaton and Cooper Pension Plan Mortality
Non-disabled
Eaton specific mortality projected with MP-2021 Improvement Scale published by the Society of Actuaries
(SOA) from the base year of 2015 for annuitants and mortality tables mandated by applicable law and
regulation as specified in IRS Regulation 1.430(h)(3)-1, as amended in the Federal Register on October 20,
2023, in TD 9983, 88 FR 72357, applied on a fully generational basis using the IRS 2024 Adjusted Scale MP-
2021 Rates mortality improvement scale for non-annuitants.
Disabled
Revenue Ruling 96-7 disabled mortality for males and females.
Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan Mortality
Mortality tables mandated by applicable law and regulation as specified in IRS Regulation 1.430(h)(3)-1, as
amended in the Federal Register on October 20, 2023, in TD 9983, 88 FR 72357, applied on a fully generational
basis using the IRS 2024 Adjusted Scale MP-2021 Rates mortality improvement scale.
Mortality for purposes of calculating lump sums
For Eaton, lump sum mortality is based on the 2024 IRS 417(e) Applicable Mortality table, as amended by IRS
Notice 2023-73. For Cooper Pension Plan and Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan, lump sum mortality is
not applicable.
Actuarial cost method
The Funding Target is the present value of accrued benefits based on compensation and service to date. The
Target Normal Cost is the present value of benefits expected to be accrued during the current plan year, reflecting
the effect of expected compensation increases during the year and including plan-related expenses expected to
be paid from plan assets during the year.

EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Statement of Actuarial Assumptions/Methods (continued)
Non-Prescribed Funding Assumptions and Methods
For Eaton the following assumptions were selected by the plan’s enrolled actuary. The asset valuation method
was selected by the plan sponsor with the actuary’s advice and is an acceptable method under PPA.
For assumptions that apply to former Cooper Pension Plan participants, the current assumptions were set based
on an experience study performed in 2022.
For assumptions that apply to former Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan participants, the current
assumptions were set by the prior actuary. We believe the current assumptions to be reasonable.
Plan Expenses
Expected plan related expenses are equal to a 5-year average of expenses paid from the Plan outside of PBGC
premiums, adjusted for inflation, plus the estimated PBGC premiums for the current year rounded up to the
nearest thousand. For 2024 the estimated plan related expenses included in the Target Normal Cost are
$24,610,000.
Salary increase assumption
For Eaton wages and salaries are assumed to increase by 4.00% per annum for 2024 and 3.00% after 2024. This
assumption is based on guidance from Eaton Corporation’s expectations for the coming years.
Inflation
For Eaton the annual inflation increase is 2.75%. This assumption is based on 25-year historical data excluding
the period after the 2008 financial crisis but including expected future inflation.
Social Security
For Eaton the annual increase in maximum wage base is 2.75%. This assumption is based on the expected
inflation assumption.
Cash Balance interest crediting rate
The interest crediting rate for Appendix CB is assumed to be equal to the forward rates for 30-Year Treasury
Securities as published by Bloomberg as of December 31, 2023. The interest crediting rate for Appendix ASD is
assumed to be equal to the forward rates for 5-Year Treasury Securities as published by Bloomberg as of
December 31, 2023. The interest crediting rate applicable to cash balance accounts of former Cooper Pension
Plan participants is assumed to be equal to the forward rates for 1-Year Treasury Securities as published by
Bloomberg as of December 31, 2023.
Cash balance index credits
For opening account balances subject to indexing under Appendix CB are assumed to increase 2.75% per annum
(in addition to interest credits) during active employment. This is assumed to be the same as inflation, which is in
line with the basis for actual index credits to participant accounts as outlined in the plan document.
Cash Balance Annuity Conversion Rate
Conversion of cash balance accounts to annuity forms of payment for former Cooper Pension Plan participants is
based on the following assumptions:
Interest – 3.25% for 2024 and 2.75% for 2023.
Mortality – Blended 1971 Group Annuity Mortality projected to 1978 with Scale E (95% male/5% female).

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Statement of Actuarial Assumptions/Methods (continued)
Non-Prescribed Funding Assumptions and Methods (continued)
Cost of Living Adjustment
For Eaton the cost of living increase is assumed to be 2.75%, when applicable. This is assumed to be the same
as inflation, which is in line with the basis for actual cost of living adjustments to participant benefits as outlined in
the plan document.
Marital Percentage
It was assumed that 82.5% of the male salaried employees and 61.5% of the female salaried employees would
be married at the time of retirement. For former Cooper Pension Plan participants, it was assumed that 80% of all
participants are married and that husbands are 3 years older than their wives. For former Cobham Orchard Park
Defined Benefit Plan participants, it was assumed that 75% of the male participants and 65% of the female
participants are married and that husbands are 4 years older than their wives. For all other participants, 85% of
the male and 65% of the female are assumed to be married. In each case the husband was assumed to be 3
years older than his wife.
Frequency of optional payment forms and assumed commencement ages
80% of cash balance participants are assumed to elect the lump sum option while 20% are assumed to take the
annuity option. Of others who are eligible, 60% are assumed to elect the lump sum form of benefit payment. Other
optional forms of payment were assumed based on the experience of each appendix over the last several years.
Optional form elections are summarized in the tables below for actives and deferred vested participants.
Deferred vested participants are assumed to commence benefits at age 62, if they are eligible for unreduced
retirement. Otherwise, the assumed commencement age is 65. Assumed commencement ages for active
participants vary based on the provisions of the applicable appendix. Active commencement ages are
summarized in the chart below.
The commencement assumption for terminating Appendix CB participants is 50% immediate commencement and
50% deferred to age 62 commencement. For terminating Appendix CB participants over age 62, 100% immediate
commencement will be assumed. The commencement assumption for Appendix CB participants who are
assumed to become disabled is 75% immediate commencement and 25% deferred until normal retirement date.
With respect to former Cooper Pension Plan participants, 15% of those with cash balance accounts are assumed
to receive their benefit in the form of a single life annuity, 7.5% are assumed to receive a 50% joint and survivor
annuity, 7.5% are assumed to receive a 100% joint and survivor annuity, and 70% are assumed to receive their
benefit in the form of a lump sum. Deferred vested participants with traditional deferred annuities are assumed to
receive their benefits in the form of a single life annuity. All future terminations with lump sum values under $15,000
are assumed 100% to take an immediate lump sum.
With respect to former Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan participants, 100% are assumed to receive their
benefit in the form of a single life annuity.

Asset valuation method
The Actuarial Value of Assets is determined using a method that spreads asset gains/(losses) over 24 months.
The gain/(loss) for each period is determined as the actual return on market value during the period less the
expected return on market value based on an assumed earnings rate chosen by the actuary but required by PPA
to be not greater than the applicable third Segment Rate. The resulting value is constrained to be within a corridor
of 90% to 110% of market value, including discounted receivable contributions.

Schedule SB, Part V – Statement of Actuarial Assumptions/Methods (continued)
Summary of Changes from the January 1, 2023 Valuation
• The interest rate basis was updated to the current rates as specified in IRS Regulation 1.430(h)(2)-1(e)(4).
• The mortality tables for valuing lump sums have been updated to the applicable rates for the current plan
year.
• For Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan annuitants and non-annuitants, Eaton non-annuitants and
former Cooper Pension Plan non-annuitants, the mortality assumption was updated according to the
projection specified in IRS Regulation 1.430(h)(3)-1, as amended in the Federal Register on October 20,
2023, in TD 9983, 88 FR 72357, applied on a fully generational basis using the IRS 2024 Adjusted Scale MP-
2021 Rates mortality improvement scale.
• Cash balance interest crediting rates have been updated to the December 31, 2023 Bloomberg forward rates
for 30-Year Treasury Securities for Appendix CB, the December 31, 2023 Bloomberg forward rates for 5-Year
Treasury Securities for Appendix ASD, and the December 31, 2023 Bloomberg forward rates for 1-Year
Treasury Securities for cash balance accounts under the former Cooper Pension Plan.
• The cash balance annuity conversion rate applicable to cash balance accounts under the former Cooper
Pension Plan was updated from 2.75% to 3.25% to reflect the administrative rate in effect for 2024 and to
reflect the trend of the decrease in the basis for such rate, i.e. the average of the PBGC rate under PBGC
Table II for the 36-month period ending in October of the year preceding such Plan Year, rounded to the next
highest 1/4%, but shall not be more than 1/4% less nor 1/2% more than the Interest Rate in the immediately
preceding Plan Year.
• With respect to benefit structures providing pay-related benefits, the salary increase rate was increased from
3.00% to 4.00% for 2024. A flat 3.00% rate was used for 2025 and thereafter.
• Expected administrative expenses included in Target Normal Cost decreased from $24,615,000 to
$24,610,000.
The impact of the above changes decreased the Funding Target by approximately $5.5M.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees covered under Appendix A of the Plan
Effective Date
Plan adopted January 1, 1944.
Eligibility
All employees covered under Appendix A who have attained age 21. Closed to new entrants December 31, 2025.
Employee Contributions
None.
Key Definitions
Average Final Annual Compensation
The highest average of total compensation in any five consecutive calendar years of the ten preceding
retirement. Annual compensation is limited in accordance with IRC §401(a)(17).
Minimum Pension Base
An amount equal to the smaller of (a) $17,700 and (b) 50% of the sum of $17,700 and the participant's
Average Final Annual Compensation.
Credited Service
Service earned after age 21 and is limited to 44 years. Frozen service effective December 31, 2025.
Normal Retirement Benefits
Eligibility
Age 65.
Amount of annual pension
Greater of (a) and (b) as follows:
(a)(1) Payable after Social Security normal retirement age:
Sum of 1% of Average Final Annual Compensation and 0.5% of the portion in excess of the
Average Social Security Limit, multiplied by Credited Service.
(a)(2) Payable until Social Security normal retirement age:
1.5% of Average Final Annual Compensation multiplied by Credited Service,
(b) Minimum pension formula: 1.25% of the Minimum Pension Base multiplied by Credited Service,
but not more than 70% of Average Final Annual Compensation at retirement date.
Frozen benefit effective December 31, 2025.
Commencement
Immediate upon retirement.
Early Retirement Benefits
Eligibility
If employment is terminated by the Company, age 50 with 10 years of service; otherwise, age 55 with 10
years of service.
Amount of annual pension:
(a) Payable after age 62- the accrued normal retirement benefit.

Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees covered under Appendix A of the Plan
(continued)
(b) Payable before age 62 - the greater of (i) 1.5% of Average Final Annual Compensation multiplied by
Credited Service, and (ii) 2% of the Minimum Pension Base multiplied by Credited Service, but not more
than 70% of annual rate of salary at retirement.
Commencement
Automatic at later of retirement date and age 60. Participants retiring prior to age 60 may elect immediate
commencement of a pension computed as in 2 above, reduced by 0.5% for each month that the
commencement precedes age 60.
Disability Retirement Benefits
Eligibility
10 years of service, and eligibility under Company LTD plan and Social Security.
Amount of annual pension
Computed as for normal retirement, except that service is projected to normal retirement date.
Commencement
Age 65.
Termination of Employment Benefits
Eligibility
5 years of service.
Amount of annual pension
The accrued normal retirement benefit, computed without the minimum pension formula.
Commencement
At age 65 or between ages 55 and 65 with a reduction of 0.5% for each month that the date of
commencement precedes age 60 if hired prior to 4/1/85; reduced 0.5% for each month that the date of
commencement precedes age 65 otherwise.
Death Benefits
Eligibility
5 years of service.
Amount of annual pension
50% of the accrued normal retirement benefit reduced as for a 50% joint and survivor option at age 65.
Commencement
Immediate upon participant's death.
Forms of Benefit Payments
50% joint and survivor form is automatic if participant is eligible, unless participant elects another form. Other
forms including a lump sum are available. All forms are actuarially equivalent.
Special Medicare Allowance
A retired participant receiving a pension is entitled to receive an allowance of $26.00 in each month of enrollment
in Part B of the federal Medicare program.
Benefit Limitations
In no event will the annual funded pension benefit exceed the limitation of IRC §415.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees covered under Appendix B of the Plan
Eligibility
All employees covered under Appendix B who have attained age 21. Closed to new entrants December 31, 2025.
Employee Contributions
No employee contributions are currently required or permitted. Employee contributions were eliminated as of
various dates as specified in the Plan.
Key Definitions
Average Final Annual Compensation
The highest average of total compensation in any five consecutive calendar years of the ten preceding retirement.
Annual compensation is limited in accordance with IRC §401(a)(17).
Credited Service
Service earned after age 21 and is limited to 44 years. Service is counted from participation dates specified in the
Plan for various employee groups. Benefits for periods prior to the specified participation dates, if any, are
determined with formulas specified in the Plan. Frozen service effective December 31, 2025.
Normal Retirement Benefits
Eligibility
Age 65.
Amount of annual pension
Greater of (a) and (b), (c) and (d):
a) The sum of
(i) the supplementary portion of pre-1/1/76 accrued benefits;
plus
(ii) 0.5% of Average Final Annual Compensation times service to 1/1/76;
plus
(iii) 1% of Average Final Annual Compensation plus 0.5% of the excess of Average Final Annual
Compensation over the average Social Security limit times Credited Service after 1/1/76.
b) The sum of
(i) the supplementary portion of pre-1/1/76 accrued benefits;
plus
(ii) An annual benefit equal to $120 plus 0.6% of Average Final Annual Compensation in excess of
$10,000, to a maximum of $2,160, times Credited Service.
c) The sum of
(i) The total pre-1/1/76 accrued benefit;
plus
(ii) 1.15% of 1975 earnings times Credited Service after 1/1/76.
d) For employees of the Milwaukee Plant with at least 10 years of service, an annual benefit equal to
service times $147.
Frozen benefit effective December 31, 2025.
Commencement
Immediately upon retirement.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees Covered under Appendix CB of the Plan
(EPPA)
Effective date
The Plan was effective January 1, 2002. Amended and restated as of January 1, 2010; amended to eliminate
coverage for participants hired on or after April 1, 2013.
Eligibility
Non-union Aeroquip & Vickers participants on January 1, 2002. Summa participants on January 1, 2003. Non-
union participants hired or rehired on or after January 1, 2002 but before April 1, 2013 with the exception of
Actuator & Sensor employees in Rochester Hills and Ann Arbor as well as Three Rivers employees. Non-union
participants who elected to participate in the EPPA as of January 1, 2003 through a pension choice process from
Appendix A, Appendix B, Appendix D, Laurinburg hourly and Roxboro hourly.
Employee Contributions
The Company pays the full cost of the plan. No contributions are required from employees.
Pay-Based Credits
The basic cash balance account is accumulated with interest credits and pay credits. The pay-based credits are
equal to a percent of earnings during each month. The percent of a participant’s pay that the plan will credit to the
cash balance account is based upon the number of age/service points accumulated up to that point. The
percentage is based on the following table:
Percent of pay to be
Age/Service Points credited to the account
Less than 50 5.0%
50-59 6.0%
60-69 7.0%
70 or more 8.0%
Annual earnings are limited in accordance with IRC §401(a)(17).
Interest Credits
The Interest Credit interest rate applicable for January through June will be based on the monthly 30-year
average Treasury bond rate of the November of the preceding calendar year. The Interest Credit interest rate
applicable for July through December will be based on the monthly 30-year average Treasury bond rate of the
May of the current calendar year.
Index Credits
Applicable for active participants who were former Appendix A, Appendix B or Appendix D participants who
elected the EPPA during the choice process. The Index Credit rate applicable for January through June will be
based on the rate of increase experienced in the Consumer Price Index from November 1 of the second
preceding calendar year to October 31 of the immediately preceding calendar year. The Index Credit rate
applicable for July through December will be based on the rate of increase experienced in the Consumer Price
Index from May 1 of the immediately preceding calendar year to April 30 of the current calendar year. Index
credits apply only to opening balances and during active employment.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees Covered under Appendix CB of the Plan
(EPPA) (continued)
Normal Retirement
Requirement
An employee’s normal retirement date is the first of the month coincident with or next following his 65th
birthday.
Benefit
The monthly retirement benefit payable to a participant at any retirement date is equal to the actuarial
equivalent of his account as of such date. Frozen benefit for LTD and JV Cummins participants effective
December 31, 2025 and all others December 31, 2020.
Termination of Employment - Vesting
Eligibility
3 years of service.
Benefit
Full account payable at termination.
Long Term Disability Retirement
If a participant becomes totally and permanently disabled and receives disability benefit under Eaton
Corporation’s Long Term Disability (LTD) Plan, his account will continue to earn pay-based and interest credits.
The pay-based credits are calculated based on the following pay formula: base pay in effect at the date of
disability; plus a 3-year average of the executive incentive compensation; plus a 3-year average of the variable
pay. During the disability, the participant will also continue to earn Service for purposes of vesting. When the
participant reaches 65 or the LTD benefits end – whichever comes later – the participant will begin receiving
benefits under any of the payment options offered by the plan.
Normal form of benefit
For non-married employees, a single life annuity paid monthly. For married participants, a joint and 50% surviving
spouse annuity.
Optional Forms of Payment Available under the Plan
a) Single Life Annuity
b) 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity
c) 66 2/3 % Joint and Survivor Annuity
d) 75% Joint and Survivor Annuity
e) 100% Joint and Survivor Annuity
Death Benefits
Pre-Commencement Death
Upon the participant’s death, the vested portion of the account will be payable to the beneficiary. If the
participant is married, the spouse will be automatically designated to be the beneficiary. If the participant is
single, the participant may name anyone as beneficiary to receive the death benefit payable.
Benefit Limitations
In no event will the annual funded pension benefit exceed the limitation of IRC §415.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Hutchinson Salaried Employees covered under
Appendix D of the Plan
Eligibility
Salaried exempt employees of the Hutchinson operation who have attained age 20 and completed one year of
service with 1,000 hours. As of 1/1/89, salaried non-exempt employees are also eligible for the plan.
Employee Contributions
None required or permitted after March 1, 1985.
Key Definitions
Average Final Annual Compensation
The highest average of total compensation in any five consecutive calendar years of the ten preceding retirement.
If member has less than five years, then average includes entire period of service. Annual compensation is limited
in accordance with IRC §401(a)(17).
Primary Social Security Benefit
The benefit payable at normal retirement date assuming earnings continue to normal retirement date at the same
rate as in effect at date of termination, as long as this date is prior to normal retirement date.
Credited Service
Service earned after age 21. Credited service earned after February 28, 1985 is limited to 30 years.
Normal Retirement:
Eligibility
Age 65 with 5 years of credited service
Amount of annual pension
Sum of (a) through (c):
a) Noncontributory portion: $180 per year of credited service prior to March 1, 1985.
b) Contributory portion: 2% of Average Final Annual Compensation in excess of $8,000 per year of
contributory credited service prior to March 1, 1985.
c) Guaranteed Percentage of Average Final Annual Compensation minus Primary Social Security
Benefit. Minimum benefit of $360 per year of credited service after February 28, 1985.
Guaranteed Percentage is the following:
Final Average Guaranteed
Compensation Percentage
$ 18,000 or less 80%
$ 24,000 72%
$ 36,000 65%
$ 60,000 58%
$ 96,000 54%
$ 120,000 and over 50%

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Hutchinson Salaried Employees covered under
Appendix D of the Plan (continued)
Early Retirement:
Eligibility
Between ages 55 and 65 with 10 years of credited service.
Amount of annual pension
Benefit using normal retirement formula but based on credited service and Final Average Compensation at
early retirement date. If projected credited service to normal retirement date after February 28, 1985 is greater
than 30 years, then Primary Social Security Benefit is reduced by the ratio of (1) greater of 30 years or
accrued credited service after February 28, 1985 to (2) projected credited service after February 28, 1985.
If benefit commences prior to normal retirement date, the reduction factor per year of early commencement is
based on member's age plus years of credited service as follows:
Age Plus Credited Service Reduction Factor
76 or less 6.0%
77 - 78 4.8%
79 - 80 4.2%
81 - 82 3.6%
83 - 84 3.0%
85 - 87 2.4%
88 and over 1.2%
Disability Retirement
Eligibility
Between ages 40 and 65 with minimum number of years of credited service as follows:
Attained Age Years Credited Service
40 15
42 14
44 13
46 12
48 11
50 and over 10
Amount of annual pension
Benefit accrued to disability retirement date same as for early retirement. Unreduced for commencement prior
to normal retirement date.
Vesting
If terminating employment after completion of five years of vesting service, benefit accrued to date of termination
same as for early retirement and payable at normal retirement date. Reduced same as for early retirement for
commencement prior to normal retirement date.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Hutchinson Salaried Employees covered under
Appendix D of the Plan (continued)
Death
Before Retirement
If a member dies while eligible for early retirement or while eligible for a vested benefit, the beneficiary will be
entitled to the benefit that would have been payable had the member terminated employment on the date of
death with payment of benefits to commence on the earliest date permitted thereafter and elected the 50%
contingent annuitant option.
After Retirement
Depends on the form of pension elected; in any event, the excess, if any, of the death benefit payable just
prior to retirement over the pension payments is paid to the beneficiary.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees Covered under Appendix ASD of the
Plan (Actuator and Sensor)
Effective date
The Plan was effective January 1, 1998. Amended and restated as of January 1, 2010; amended to eliminate
coverage for participants hired on or after April 1, 2013.
Eligibility
All active employees of Eaton employed prior to April 1, 2013 by the Lectron Division become members on the
date of hire, the first month coincident with or following the date the employee reaches age 21 or the date the plan
applies to the employee’s business unit.
Employee Contributions
The Company pays the full cost of the plan. No contributions are required from employees.
Pay-Based Credits
The basic cash balance account is accumulated with interest credits and pay credits. The pay-based credits are
equal to a percent of earnings during the previous six months. The percent of a participant’s pay that the plan will
credit to the cash balance account is based upon the number of age/service points accumulated up to that point.
The percentage is based on the following table:
Percent of pay to be
Age/Service Points credited to the account
Less than 30 3.00%
30-39 3.50%
40-49 4.00%
50-59 4.50%
60-69 5.00%
70-79 5.50%
80-89 6.00%
90 or more 6.50%
At termination, the employee will receive a final pay-based credit equal to a percent of pay credited since the
previous June 30 or December 31 through the termination date. The final percent of pay will be based on the total
amount of age/service points accumulated as of the termination date.
Annual earnings are limited in accordance with IRC §401(a)(17).
Interest Credits
Interest credits are set semi-annually as of June 30 and December 31, based on the account balance as of the
beginning of the six-month period ending on those dates. The annual rate used to calculate the interest credit is
determined as of the beginning of each calendar year. The rate for a given calendar year equals the average yield
on five-year U.S. Treasury notes during the 12-month period ending on November 30 of the previous calendar
year.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Employees Covered under Appendix ASD of the
Plan (Actuator and Sensor) (continued)
Normal Retirement
Requirement
An employee’s normal retirement date is the first of the month coincident with or next following his 65th
birthday.
Benefit
The monthly retirement benefit payable to a participant at any retirement date is equal to the actuarial
equivalent of his account as of such date.
Termination of Employment - Vesting
Eligibility
3 years of service.
Benefit
Full account payable at termination.
Long Term Disability Retirement:
If a participant becomes totally and permanently disabled and receives disability benefit under Eaton
Corporation’s Long-Term Disability (LTD) Plan, his account will continue to earn pay-based and interest credits.
The pay-based credits are calculated assuming that the participant earns compensation equal to an average of
the compensation the participant earned during the five calendar years prior to the disability, calculated in
accordance with Plan rules. During the disability, the participant will also continue to earn Service for purposes of
vesting. When the participant reaches 65 or the LTD benefits end – whichever comes later – the participant will
begin receiving benefits under any of the payment options offered by the plan.
Normal form of benefit
For non-married employees, a 10 years-certain single life annuity paid monthly. For married participants, a joint
and 50% surviving spouse annuity.
Optional forms of payment
The participant, depending on marital status, may elect to receive the plan benefit under one of the following
payment options:
1. Lump sum (automatic if benefit amount is $5,000 or less).
2. 10 years certain and life annuity.
3. 50% joint and survivorship annuity.
4. 100% joint and survivorship annuity.
Death Benefits
Pre-Commencement Death
Upon the participant’s death, the vested portion of the account will be payable to the beneficiary. If the
participant is married, the spouse will be automatically designated to be the beneficiary. If the participant is
single, the participant may name anyone as beneficiary to receive the death benefit payable.

Early Retirement
Requirement
a) Age 62 with 5 years of vesting service
b) Age 60 with 10 years of vesting service
c) Age 58 with 30 years of vesting service
Benefit
Benefits accrued to early retirement date based on vesting service at early retirement date reduced 7.2% for
each year benefit commencement precedes age 62.
Members retiring early who have completed 30 years of vesting service will be entitled to the full accrued
benefit without reduction. Members retiring after age 58 with 30 years of vesting service or age 60 with 10
years of vesting service will be entitled to a Supplemental Allowance.
Disability Retirement
Requirement
a) For local 475, eligible under company LTD plan.
b) For local 1966, 10 years of vesting service.
Benefit
a) For local 475, the benefit, payable at 65 with credited service to age 65, as computed for normal
retirement. The benefit is based on the multiplier in effect at the date the participant is on LTD.
b) For local 1966, the benefit, payable immediately, as computed for normal retirement. The monthly benefit
shall be doubled during any month in which the employee is not eligible for an unreduced federal Social
Security benefit for age or disability.
Members retiring due to disability after age 58 with 30 years of vesting service or age 60 with 10 years of
vesting service will be entitled to a Supplemental Allowance.
Supplemental Allowance
The benefit equals the amount when added to the monthly retirement benefit and any Social Security benefits for
which the employee is entitled limited to 70% of salary no less than the total of:
a) for employees of local 475, on or after September 15, 2001, but before September 15, 2005, $1,600 per
month;
b) for employees of local 475, on or after September 15, 2005, $1,700 per month;
c) for employees of local 1966, on or after September 17, 2001, $1,600 per month;
And is payable until age 62. The supplemental allowance is reduced by the ratio of credited service up to 30
years divided by 30 years.

for early retirement or later reduced by 7.2% for each year benefit commencement precedes age 62. No
reduction if 30 or more years of vesting service.

The benefit equals 50% of the deferred pension or the amount that would have been payable to the participant

Employee Contributions
None

Death Benefit
Requirement
Former and active vested employees and retirees who have elected the normal form of the survivor benefit,
who have been married a least one year and have 5 years of service. Benefits are reduced by 5% (plus or
minus 0.5% for each year after 5 but not more than 10 by which employee is older or younger than their
spouse).
Benefit
a) Active and terminated employees eligible for early or normal retirement:
Monthly survivor benefit shall be equal to 60% of the accrued benefit the employees would have received
if he retired the day before his death. Benefit payment begins on the first day of the month following the
date of death.
b) Retired employees:
Monthly survivor benefit shall be equal to 60% of the benefit for which retiree was eligible. Benefit
payment begins on the first day of the month following the date of death.
c) Active vested and terminated vested employees:
Monthly survivor benefit shall be equal to 50% of the monthly benefit to which the employees would have
been entitled had he terminated on the earlier of his termination date or date of death, survived to early
retirement date and had begun receiving benefits that day, and died the next day. Benefit payment begins
on early retirement date.
d) 30 years of service:
For active employees with 30 or more years of credited service, the survivor’s benefit is computed without
reduction for age.
e) Age plus service total 85:
For active employees over age 55 or retired employees retiring after age 55, with age plus service greater
than or equal to 85, the survivor’s benefit is computed without reduction for age.
f) Duplication Clause:
Survivor Benefit not payable concurrently with group insurance Transition or Bridge benefits.

Benefit
Greater of
(a) The CAM method
For each year, commencing with February 1, 1994, during which a participant has elected to
contribute, 1/12 of 2% of total compensation per month (minimum of $15), multiplied by service for
that year. Or, if the participant has elected not to contribute, $19 per month, multiplied by service for
that year;
or,
(b) The FAC method
If a participant has elected to contribute when first eligible to do so, the pension amount is based on
the Final Average Compensation Schedule set forth in the Plan Document subsection 1(d). If a
participant has elected not to contribute, $15 per month, multiplied by service for that year.
or,
(c) Statutory minimum
Employee’s contributions with interest converted to a monthly amount at benefit commencement
date.
Annual compensation is limited in accordance with IRC §401(a)(17).
Annuity benefits are guaranteed for a minimum of 60 months.

Early Retirement
Requirement
a) Age 60 and at least 10 years of service, or
b) Age 58 and at least 30 years of service.

for each year preceding age 60.
If a participant has less than 30 years of service, the greater of the CAM benefit as described above reduced
by 4% for each year preceding normal retirement date; or the FAC benefit without reduction.

retirement date, payable to age 62.

employee with less than 5 years of service is vested in the accrued benefit derived from employee
contributions.
Pre-Retirement Death Benefit
If a participant dies before benefit commencement and has (a) at least 25 years of service, (b) age 50 with at least
15 years of service, (c) age 60 with at least 10 years of service, or (d) eligible for normal retirement, automatic
"joint and 55%" benefit form payable to the surviving spouse commencing at date of death. If a participant dies
after having 5 years of service, but before meeting the above eligibility requirements, the “joint and 55%” benefit is
deferred to the earliest date the employee could have retired. If death occurs before 5 years of service, the
beneficiary is paid contributions with interest. Benefits are reduced by 7.5% (plus or minus 0.5% for each year up
to 15 by which employee is older or younger than their spouse).
Employee Contributions
If a participant chooses to contribute to the plan, 1.5% of total annual compensation, accumulated at 120% of the
Federal Mid-Term rate.
Benefit Limitations
In no event will the annual funded pension benefit exceed the limitation of IRC §415.

Benefit
$4.25 per month per year of credited service payable monthly on early retirement date until the first day of the
month preceding 65th birthday or death.
Disability Retirement
None.
Vesting
Requirement
5 years of credited service.
Benefit
The benefit equals the accrued benefit plus, if applicable, any minimum pension benefit adjustment. The
member may elect, at any time before benefit commencement, to receive the Cash Payment earned.
The benefit is reduced 3.5% from age 55 for each year that benefit commencement precedes normal
retirement date.
If a member terminates before attaining vested status, the deferred benefit equals the benefit that can be
purchased by the amount of Cash Payment. The member may elect, at any time before benefit
commencement, to receive the Cash Payment.
Pre-Retirement Death Benefit
The benefit equals 50% of the deferred pension or the amount that would have been payable to the participant
had he retired and elected a joint and survivor annuity, exclusive of early retirement supplement. This benefit may
be reduced if the beneficiary receives a lump sum payment equal to the Cash Payment the participant could have
received had he terminated employment.
Post-Retirement Death Benefit
If a retired member had at least 10 years of service at retirement, the beneficiary is eligible to receive a lump sum
payment according to the following table:
Years Credited Service Lump Sum Amount
10 $ 1,750
20 $ 2,250
30+ $ 2,500
Forms of Retirement Income
The normal form is a modified cash refund life annuity which guarantees that the sum of the pension payments
will be no less in aggregate than an amount equal to the Cash Payment the employee is able to elect.
The amount of the Cash Payment the employee is able to elect equals 2.5% of each year’s pay accumulated at
an interest rate of 3.5% per annum.
If the member elects to receive a Cash Payment and remains entitled to the balance of the accrued pension, the
normal form is a no-refund life annuity (no minimum total guarantee).

Delayed Retirement
A participant may continue in the employment of the Employer after his/her Normal Retirement Date. In such
event the participant will receive at actual retirement the Normal Retirement Benefit calculated using service and
compensation as of the actual retirement date.
Accrued Benefit
The Normal Retirement Benefit as described above calculated using the applicable benefit rate and Credited
Service as of the accrual date.
Early Retirement Benefits
Eligibility
Age 55 with 10 Years of Vesting Service
Benefit Amount
Normal Retirement Benefit reduced by 5/12 of 1% for each month that commencement precedes age 62.
Certain Employees of Aircraft Workers Alliance Amalgamated Inc., are eligible for a temporary supplement
payable until age 62, offset by benefits payable from T.R.W. The temporary supplement is $1,000 for
participants who retire prior to April 1, 1994, $1,300 for participants who retire between April 1, 1994 and
March 31, 1997, and $1,350 for participants who retire on or after April 1, 1997.
Early Retirement Window
Eligible participants who retired during the period January 1, 2005 through April 1, 2005 received an
additional $200 per month payable as a temporary life annuity to age 62.
Vested Benefit
Accrued Benefit times Vesting Percentage payable at Normal Retirement Date. At the election of the Participant,
benefits may commence on or after the Early Retirement Date subject to a reduction of .55 of 1% for each full
month by which pension commencement precedes the Normal Retirement Date.
Death Benefit
The spouse of a participant who is vested and has been married one year, is eligible for a pre-retirement spouse’s
benefit equal to 50% of the joint annuity benefit which the participant would have received, had he/she survived,
and elected a 50% joint survivor annuity, commencing upon attainment of his/her earliest retirement date.
Normal Form of Payment
A reduced 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity if the participant has an eligible spouse unless such coverage is
declined by the participant and his/her spouse. Life Annuity for single employees.

EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029

Outline of principal provisions applicable to EU (Argo-Tech) Hourly Employees (continued)
Optional Methods of Settlement
All Optional Methods of Settlement are actuarially equivalent to the Normal Form of Payment. If a married
participant does not elect the Normal Form of Payment or does not elect one of the Optional Methods of
Settlement described below, then the participant’s Retirement Benefit shall automatically be paid under option [1]
below.
All optional Methods of Settlement are actuarially equivalent to the Normal Form of Payment based on the 1951
Group Annuity Mortality Table for Males, projected with Scale C to 1980 and set back one year for employees and
seven years for contingent annuitants and an interest rate of 7% per annum.
The options are:
1. A reduced benefit to be paid during the participant’s lifetime with one-half of the reduced benefit to be
continued to the designated beneficiary for his/her lifetime after the participant’s death.
2. A reduced benefit to be paid during the participant’s lifetime with one-fourth or three-fourths of the
reduced benefit to be continued to the designated beneficiary for his/her lifetime after the participant’s
death.
3. A reduced benefit to be paid during the participant’s lifetime with the same reduced benefit to be
continued to the designated beneficiary for his/her lifetime after the participant’s death.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Moeller Employees
Effective Date
Plan adopted May 1, 1970: amended as of May 1, 1976 for ERISA; and restated effective January 1, 2001. Latest
amendment effective January 1, 2002.
Merger
Plan was merged into the Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees as of January 29, 2010.
Vesting Service
A year of service for vesting and benefits means a plan year in which the employee completes 1,000 hours of
service. Partial credit for under 1,000 hours is only given for benefit credit. No service is credited after December
17, 2004.
Service Eligibility Requirements
Employees become members on the first January 1 or July 1 upon which the following requirements have been
satisfied.
(a) Completion of one year of service (during first 12 months of employment or any subsequent plan year);
and
(b) Attainment of age 21
Employee Contributions
None.
Normal Retirement Benefits
Normal Retirement Date
The first day of the month coincident with or next following attainment of age 65.
Normal Retirement Benefit
On or after May 1, 1989: The sum of 1% of final average five-year earnings not in excess of covered
compensation plus 1.5% of final average five-year earnings in excess of covered compensation, multiplied by
credited service, to a maximum of 30 years of credited service. Covered compensation is the average of the
Social Security taxable wage bases over the 35-year period ending in the year of attainment of Social
Security retirement age.
However, the amount of pension will never be less than the benefit accrued as of May 1, 1989 under the prior
benefit formula. Sum of (a) and (b) with total result multiplied by (c) as follows:
(a) 1.0% of Average Annual Earnings not in excess of Covered Compensation,
(b) 1.5% of Average Annual Earnings in excess of Covered Compensation,
(c) A Participant’s Years of Benefit Service up to a maximum of 30 years.
Deferred Retirement
Eligibility
5 years of service
Amount of annual pension
Monthly benefit, based on service and salary to date of termination, payable commencing at normal
retirement date or in a reduced amount at early retirement date (if eligible).

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to Moeller Employees (continued)
Pre-retirement Death Benefits
If a member eligible for a vested benefit and not receiving benefits dies while covered by the plan, his surviving
spouse shall receive a lifetime benefit equal to the amount that would have been payable to her if the member
had retired early on the first day of the month of death, or age 55 if not eligible for early retirement, and had
elected a 50% Joint and Survivor benefit.
Normal Form of Payment
The normal form of pension is a Life Annuity. For a married employee, an actuarially reduced pension will be
payable in the form of a Joint and Survivor Annuity unless the employee properly elects to receive either the
normal form of pension or an optional form of benefit.
Optional Forms of Payment Available under the Plan
a) Single Life Annuity
b) 50% Joint and Survivor Annuity
c) 66 2/3 % Joint and Survivor Annuity
d) 75% Joint and Survivor Annuity
e) 100% Joint and Survivor Annuity
Optional Forms Actuarial Equivalence Basis
Interest Rate
7.00%
Mortality Table
The 1984 UNISEX Pension Mortality Table with ages set forward 1 year for employees and set back 4 years
for beneficiaries.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan
Effective December 31, 2018 the Cooper Pension Plan merged into the Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation
Employees.
Former Cooper Retirement Annuity Plan
Coverage and Participation
No new employees are allowed to enter the plan. Participation occurred for prior plans as of each applicable
merger date.
Prior Plans
Plan Name Merger Date
Diamond Hourly 04/01/1995
Utica Tool Hourly 05/31/1995
Kirsch Employees 10/30/1995
Brush Fuses 12/31/1995
Connectron 12/31/1995
Kirsch Hourly 12/31/1995
Moog Defined Employees 12/31/1995
Cameron Hourly 12/31/1998
Canonsburg 12/31/1998
Michigan City 12/31/1998
Kearney-Fayetteville 04/30/1999
Springfield 04/30/1999
Rotor Tool 12/31/1999
Eagle Electric 12/01/2001
Houston Hourly 01/01/2004

Vesting Service
One year is credited for each Plan Year in which at least 1,000 Hours of Service are completed. Various other
definitions were in effect for the Prior Plans.
Benefit Service
One year is credited for each Plan Year in which at least 1,700 Hours of Service are completed, with fractional
service credited for less than 1,700 hours as 1/10th year of Benefit Service for each full 170 Hours of Service.
Various other definitions were in effect for the Prior Plans. Benefit Service was frozen prior to or during the
respective plan merger dates.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan (continued)
Normal Retirement
Eligibility
Age 65.
Amount of annual pension
Greater of (i) and (ii), less (iii):
(i) 50% of final average earnings less 50% of Social Security PIA, with such difference pro-rated for
less than 30 years of Benefit Service;
(ii) $144 times years of Benefit Service;
(iii) The annuity equivalent of any Profit Sharing Plan balance.
Final average earnings are computed based on the highest five consecutive years of basic compensation out
of the last 10 years of employment. All salaries are limited by the provisions of IRC Section 401(a)(17).
Various other benefit formulas were in effect for the Prior Plans.
All benefit accruals for all participants were frozen prior to or during the respective plan merger dates.
Early Retirement
Eligibility
Age 55 with 5 years of Vesting Service. Retirement provisions for former Participants of Prior Plans continue in
effect.
Amount of annual pension
The Early Retirement Benefit is the accrued Normal Retirement Benefit reduced 0.6% for each of the first 60
months and 0.3% for each additional month that commencement precedes age 65. Applicable early retirement
reductions under Prior Plans continue in effect.
Disability Retirement
Eligibility
Eligible upon total and permanent disability after 10 years of Vesting Service.
Amount of annual pension
The disability benefit is the Normal Retirement Benefit based on imputed service to age 65 and final average
earnings, PIA benefit and Profit Sharing balance at date of disability, payable at age 65. Alternative disability
provisions applicable to former participants of the Prior Plans continue in effect.
Termination Benefit
Eligibility
Eligible upon termination at any age and 5 years of Vesting Service. Effective July 1, 1993, any Participant who
is terminated as a result of the plant closing will become 100% vested regardless of Service. This provision
was extended to non-retired Reno participants during 1996.
Amount of annual pension
The vested termination benefit is the accrued Normal Retirement Benefit payable at age 65 or, alternatively, a
reduced pension payable as early as age 55. Alternative vested termination provisions applicable to former
Participants of the Prior Plans continue in effect.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan (continued)
Pre-Retirement Survivor Benefit
Eligibility
The surviving spouse becomes eligible upon death of a Participant or former Participant after completion of 5
years of Vesting Service, provided the Participant or former Participant has been married to his current spouse
for at least one year.
Amount of annual pension
The surviving spouse will receive the benefit payable assuming the decedent terminated on the date of death,
survived to earliest retirement date, retired under the 50% Joint & Survivor form of payment and then died.
Alternative spousal coverage provisions applicable to former Participants of the Prior Plans continue in effect.
Form of Payment
The normal form of payment is a Single Life Annuity for single Participants and an actuarially equivalent 50% Joint
& Survivor Annuity for married participants. Alternative forms of payment provisions applicable to former
Participants of the Prior Plans continue in effect.
A participant may take the present value of his normal retirement benefit in the form of a lump sum upon
termination if the present value does not exceed $10,000.
Lump Sums not exceeding $5,000 are mandatorily cashed out.
Actuarial Equivalence
The definition of Actuarial Equivalence varies by Prior Plan.
For lump-sums, the 417(e) interest rate for November of the prior year and 417(e) mortality.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan (continued)
Coverage and Participation
Prior to December 31, 2006, the first day of the Plan Year after an eligible employee attains age 21. The Plan was
frozen on December 31, 2006, and no Eligible Employee can become a member after August 1, 2006.
Vesting Service
Vesting Service is equal to an employee’s period of employment measured in years and days.
Compensation
All Compensation paid during a Plan Year including elective salary deferrals with the exception of: relocation
expense differentials; mortgage interest differentials; fringe benefits; accrued or unused vacation pay paid with
respect to a period following termination of employment; severance payments; auto allowance income; foreign
service premiums; other deferred compensation; welfare benefits; sign- on bonuses; long term management
incentive comp awards; patent awards; safety awards; and service awards.
Account Balance
The Account Balance for each Participant consists of the following:
Initial Balance
A Participant’s employer-provided accrued benefit under a prior plan converted to a lump sum on July 1, 1986.
Basic Credits
Prior to December 31, 2006, the Participant shall receive a Basic Credit each pay period equal to 4.0% of
Compensation, plus 4.0% of Compensation in excess of the Social Security Taxable Wage Base. The Plan
was frozen on December 31, 2006, and no Participant can accrue additional Basic Credits after that date.
Transitional Credits
Participants who are Eligible Employees as of July 1, 1986 shall have additional pay credits added to their
Account Balance each pay period through June 1987, 1988, 1989, 1990, or 1991, depending on the
Participant’s date of birth and years of service as of December 31, 1986.
Additional Credits
Prior to December 31, 2006, certain Participants employed on September 30, 1989 had their Account Balance
credited on and after October 1, 1989 with an additional monthly credit ranging from $10 to $130 depending on
the Participant’s age at December 31, 1989 and whether or not retiree medical coverage was elected. Effective
December 31, 2006, all remaining active Participants eligible for Additional Credits received a one-time
additional Account Balance increase as a result of the Plan freeze effective December 31, 2006. The Plan was
frozen on December 31, 2006, and no Participant can accrue Additional Credits after that date.
Interest Credits
The Account Balance increases each year with interest equal to the average yield on One-Year Treasury
Constant Maturities for the November of the preceding year, rounded to the next highest quarter percentage
point.
Effective December 31, 2006, certain Participants received a one-time increase to their Account Balance.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan (continued)
Minimum Grandfather Benefit
Participants who were Eligible Employees as of July 1, 1986 and who become eligible for a retirement benefit prior
to July 1, 1991 shall have a minimum benefit equal to the lump sum value of their prior plan accrued benefit
determined as if the Participant had continued in the prior plan for up to five years after July 1, 1986.
Minimum Benefit
Eligible to Participants hired before August 1, 2004.
Prior to December 31, 2006, the monthly Minimum Benefit payable as a single life annuity at Normal Retirement is
equal to $15 per year of service. The Plan was frozen on December 31, 2006, and no Employee can accrue
additional years of service attributable to the Minimum Benefit after that date.
Termination Benefit
A Participant shall become 100% vested in the Initial Balance, Minimum Grandfather Benefit and Minimum Benefit
upon completion of 5 years of service. All other benefits vest according to the following schedule:
Years of Vesting Service Percent Vested
0 to 2 0.0%
3 33.3%
4 66.7%
5+ 100.0%
Effective January 1, 2008, a Participant shall be 100% vested upon completion of 3 Years of Vesting Service.
Normal Retirement
Eligibility
Age 65.
Amount of annual pension
The monthly Normal Retirement Benefit is equal to the Account Balance at Normal Retirement.
Early Retirement
Eligibility
Age 55 with 10 years of Vesting Service.
Amount of annual pension
The monthly Early Retirement Benefit is equal to the Account Balance at Early Retirement.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan (continued)
Disability Retirement
Eligibility
Eligible after 1 year of Vesting Service and deemed to have a Total Disability per the Local Administrative
Committee.
Amount of annual pension
A Temporary Benefit equal to 50% of base pay less 64% of the primary Social Security benefit, payable
beginning five months after the date of disability until the earlier of death, recovery or retirement. The liability
associated with the Temporary Benefit for a closed group of participants on LTD was transferred to an
insurance company effective December 31, 2006. The Temporary Benefit was then eliminated effective
December 31, 2006.
Each disabled Participant’s account will be credited with interest credits, basic credits, transitional credits, and
additional credits (if applicable) until attaining age 65 assuming continuous disability and assuming the
member’s compensation prior to disability remained unchanged. At age 65, a monthly benefit or an equivalent
lump sum becomes payable.
Credits, other than interest credits, were frozen effective December 31, 2007 for currently disabled
Participants. This provision was then eliminated effective December 31, 2007.
The Disability Retirement provisions of the Plan were eliminated for Participants not currently on LTD effective
December 31, 2006.
Pre-Retirement Survivor Benefit
Eligibility
The surviving spouse becomes eligible upon the death of a Participant or former Participant who completed 3
or more years of Vesting Service.
Amount of annual pension
The surviving spouse will receive either a lump sum equal to the Participant’s vested Account Balance, or an
equivalent life annuity.
Form of Payment
The Normal Form of Payment is a Single Life Annuity for single Participants and an actuarially equivalent 50%
Joint & Survivor Annuity for married Participants.
Optional Forms of Payment are:
- Single Life Annuity
- 50%, 75% and 100% Joint & Contingent Annuity
- Social Security Leveling at age 62
- Above forms with a full cash refund feature
- Lump sum
- 10 Year Certain & Continuous
- Increasing Life Annuity

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cooper Pension Plan (continued)
The Normal and Optional Forms of Payment for pre- cash balance terminated vested participants varies by Prior
Plan.
A cash balance participant may take the present value of his normal retirement benefit in the form of a lump sum
upon termination if the present value does not exceed $15,000.
Lump Sums not exceeding $5,000 are mandatorily cashed out.
Actuarial Equivalence
For converting account balances to annuities, the interest is based on the average of the PBGC rate under PBGC
Table II for the 36-month period ending in October of the preceding Plan Year (rounded to the next highest1/4%
but not more than ¼% less or ½% more than the year prior). Mortality is based on the 1971 Group Annuity
Mortality Table projected to 1978 using scale E, further adjusted by .95. For conversions at ages between 60 and
65, the factor applicable to a conversion at age 65 shall be used and for a conversion at an age less than age 60,
the applicable factor shall be the actual age plus 5 years.
Optional Forms of Payment based on Plan factors.
For traditional annuity lump-sums, the 417(e) interest rate for November of the prior year and 417(e) mortality.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit
Plan
Effective December 31, 2021, the Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan merged into the Pension Plan for
Eaton Corporation Employees.
Former Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan
Coverage and Participation
No new employees are allowed to enter the plan. Participation occurred for the prior plan for employees hired
before December 31, 2003.
Vesting Service
Computation period in which an Employee receives credit for one or more hours of service. The computation
period is the 12-month period from the date the employee was hired for the first year, and then the Plan Year for
determining a Year of Eligibility Service in subsequent years.
Creditable Service
Effective December 31, 2018, no participant will be credited with additional service. Effective January 1, 1994
service is credited for each month that the participant completed an hour of service. Service prior to 1994 is
computed under prior plan terms.
Normal Retirement
Eligibility
Age 65.
Amount of annual pension
Benefit accruals were frozen effective December 31, 2018.
Participants receive benefit credit in each calendar year of plan participation equal to (i) plus (ii):
(i) 1.25% of the Participant’s Annual Compensation not in excess of $18,000;
(ii) 1.75% of the Participant’s Annual Compensation in excess of $18,000.
Benefits are credited to a Participant for forty-five (45) years of Creditable Service. In the event that a
Participant has more than forty-five (45) years of Creditable Service, only those forty-five (45) years of the
Creditable Service which produce the greatest monthly retirement benefit are taken into account.
Early Retirement
Eligibility
Attainment of age 55 and 15 years of vesting service.
Amount of annual pension
Accrued benefit reduced by one-half of one percent (0.5%) for each month by which the commencement date
of the benefit precedes the participant’s Normal Retirement Date.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Part V – Summary of Plan Provisions (continued)
Outline of principal provisions applicable to the former Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit
Plan (continued)
Pre-Retirement Survivor Benefit
Eligibility
5 years of vesting service
Amount of annual pension
One-half of the benefit that would have been paid if the participant had retired the day before he died under
the joint and survivor option. Benefits are paid immediately or at the participant’s early retirement age, if later.
Termination Benefit
Eligibility
5 years of vesting service
Amount of annual pension
Accrued benefit payable at normal retirement date or at early retirement. If paid at early retirement, the benefit
Is actuarially reduced for each month that retirement precedes age 65.
Normal Form of Payment
If married, benefits are paid in the form of a joint and survivor annuity. If not married, benefits are payable for the
life of the participant.
Optional Forms of Payment
In lieu of the Normal Form of Payment, participants may elect one of the following optional forms of payment:
- Single Life Annuity
- 5, 10, or 15 Year Certain & Continuous
- 50%, 75%, or 100% Joint & Contingent Annuity
Actuarial Equivalence
Optional forms of payment are actuarially equivalent to the normal form of payment for single participants, i.e. the
life annuity option. The conversion factors are calculated using actuarial equivalence, which by definition is based
on the 1971 Group Annuity Mortality Table with a 95% male and 5% female blend and an interest rate of 6%.
The Lump sum value is calculated using the IRS Lump Sum Mortality Table and the segment rates published for
November of the prior year.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Line 23 – Information on Use of Substitute Mortality Tables
The substitute mortality table applies to Eaton annuitants and former Cooper Pension Plan annuitants, excluding
disabled participants, Cobham Orchard Park Defined Benefit Plan annuitants and non-annuitants, Eaton non-
annuitants, and former Cooper Pension Plan non-annuitants, which use the prescribed mortality table for the
2024 plan year. The mortality ratios used to develop the table are 1.055227 for male annuitants, 1.122307 for
female annuitants, 0.887648 for male non-annuitants, and 1.1054317 for female non-annuitants. The tables are
based on full credibility for male annuitants, 94% credibility for female annuitants, 39% credibility for male non-
annuitants, and 21% credibility for female non-annuitants. The substitute mortality tables have been approved
beginning with the plan year commencing January 1, 2019 and ending with the plan year commencing January
1, 2028.

Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
EIN/PN: 34-0196300 / 029
Schedule SB, Line 24 – Changes in Actuarial Assumptions
• Cash balance interest crediting rates have been updated to the December 31, 2023 Bloomberg forward
rates for 30-Year Treasury Securities for Appendix CB, the December 31, 2023 Bloomberg forward rates for
5-Year Treasury Securities for Appendix ASD, and the December 31, 2023 Bloomberg forward rates for 1-
Year Treasury Securities for cash balance accounts under the former Cooper Pension Plan.
• The cash balance annuity conversion rate applicable to cash balance accounts under the former Cooper
Pension Plan was updated from 2.75% to 3.25% to reflect the administrative rate in effect for 2024 and to
reflect the trend of the decrease in the basis for such rate, i.e. the average of the PBGC rate under PBGC
Table II for the 36-month period ending in October of the year preceding such Plan Year, rounded to the
next highest 1/4%, but shall not be more than 1/4% less nor 1/2% more than the Interest Rate in the
immediately preceding Plan Year.
• With respect to benefit structures providing pay-related benefits, the salary increase rate was increased from
3.00% to 4.00% for 2024. A flat 3.00% rate was used for 2025 and thereafter.
• Expected administrative expenses included in Target Normal Cost decreased from $24,615,000 to
$24,610,000.
These changes increased the Funding Target by approximately $7.9M.

INDEPENDENT AUDITOR'S REPORT
Retirement and Investment Committee of the
Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
Beachwood, Ohio
Scope and Nature of the ERISA Section 103(a)(3)(C) Audit
We have performed an audit of the financial statements of the Pension Plan for Eaton Corporation Employees
(the “Plan”), an employee benefit plan subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974
(ERISA), as permitted by ERISA Section 103(a)(3)(C) (ERISA Section 103(a)(3)(C) audit). The financial
statements comprise the statement of net assets available for benefits as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, and
the related statement of changes in net assets available for benefits for the years then ended, and the related
notes to the financial statements.
Management, having determined it is permissible in the circumstances, has elected to have the audit of the
Plan’s financial statements performed in accordance with ERISA Section 103(a)(3)(C) pursuant to 29 CFR
2520.103-8 of the Department of Labor’s Rules and Regulations for Reporting and Disclosure under ERISA.
As permitted by ERISA Section 103(a)(3)(C), our audit need not extend to any statements or information
related to assets held for investment of the plan (investment information) by a bank or similar institution or
insurance carrier that is regulated, supervised, and subject to periodic examination by a state or federal agency,
provided that the statements or information regarding assets so held are prepared and certified to by the bank
or similar institution or insurance carrier in accordance with 29 CFR 2520.103-5 of the Department of Labor’s
Rules and Regulations for Reporting and Disclosure under ERISA (qualified institution).
Management has obtained certifications from qualified institutions, The Bank of New York Mellon/BNY
Mellon, N.A. and State Street Bank and Trust Company, as of and for the years ended December 31, 2024 and
2023, stating that the certified investment information, as described in Note 3 to the financial statements, is
complete and accurate.
Opinion
In our opinion, based on our audit and on the procedures performed as described in the Auditor’s
Responsibilities for the Audit of the Financial Statements section:
• the amounts and disclosures in the accompanying financial statements, other than those agreed to or
derived from the certified investment information, are presented fairly, in all material respects, in
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
• the information in the accompanying financial statements related to assets held by and certified to by a
qualified institution agrees to, or is derived from, in all material respects, the information prepared and
certified by an institution that management determined meets the requirements of ERISA Section
103(a)(3)(C).
Basis for Opinion
We conducted our audit in accordance with auditing standards generally accepted in the United States of
America (GAAS). Our responsibilities under those standards are further described in the Auditor’s
Responsibilities for the Audit of the Financial Statements section of our report. We are required to be
independent of the Plan and to meet our other ethical responsibilities, in accordance with the relevant ethical
requirements relating to our audits. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and
appropriate to provide a basis for our ERISA Section 103(a)(3)(C) audit opinion.
